name: DS Tuc A
scenarioDescription:
The DS Tuc A Exoplanetary System


Overview

DS Tuc A is a star with 1.01 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.96 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.045 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

DS Tuc A is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the DS Tuc A system


DS Tuc A b

DS Tuc A b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of DS Tuc A b is 413.40000000000003 times the mass of Earth. The radius of DS Tuc A b is 5.7 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, DS Tuc A b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system DS Tuc A, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
